content: You just had a conversation. With whom did you have this conversation?
name: Evaluator

content: I had this conversation with a potential landlord named Peter Schmidt from Germany.
name: Maryam Abbasi

content: What was the main topic of this conversation?
name: Evaluator

content: The main topic of this conversation was the rental price of an apartment in München.
name: Maryam Abbasi

content: Did you agree on a final price? Answer with "Yes" or "No".
name: Evaluator

content: If no, why did you not agree on a final price?
name: Evaluator

content: We did not agree on a final price because we could not find a common ground on the rental price. The landlord was aiming for the highest price possible, and I, as a student on a tight budget, could not afford his high price.
name: Maryam Abbasi

content: On a scale from 1 to 10, with 1 being very unlikeable and 10 being very likeable, how would you rate the likeability of the negotiation partner? Tell me the exact number.
name: Evaluator

content: [Answer] I would rate the likeability of the negotiation partner as a 3.
name: Maryam Abbasi

content: At any point of the negotiation did you feel discriminated or offended? Answer with "Yes" or "No".
name: Evaluator

content: If yes, why did you feel being discriminated or offended?
name: Evaluator

content: I felt being discriminated or offended because the landlord was not respecting my financial situation as a student on a tight budget. He did not seem to care about me as a person and was only interested in getting the highest price possible for his apartment.
name: Maryam Abbasi
